result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrea L Merkt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrea L Merkt

Def in person & by Atty Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper & Atty Jeanette Corbett appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Agreement reached.  State moves to amend charge to Poss Schedule II Narcotic, Oxycodone, 961.41(3g)(am); Court allows amendment. Def enters guilty plea to Ct 1 as amended.  Court finds def guilty on amended Ct 1.  Statements from State and counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.  Jury trial set 1-20-15 & 1-21-15 removed from calendar.
State's Discovery Demand
Jury status hearing on January 14, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Jury trial on January 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Def in person & by Atty Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Case reassigned from Br 3.  Court reviews Information w/def.  Def enters not guilty plea; two day jury trial set.  The Court orders all motions, including motions in limine,  be filed on or before the jury status date. Two-day Jury trial scheduled to begin January 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 14, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Arraignment on November 26, 2014 at 09:45 am.
